name: rattling

rattling adjective
(SOUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
making a series of knocking sounds: The machine was making a rattling noise. He arrived in a pickup truck with a rattling exhaust. Related word
rattleCompare
rattly
More examplesFewer examplesThe wind was howling through the rattling windows.There is a slight rattling sound from the engine until I reach a constant speed. Soon there was only the rattling echo of its wheels on the cobblestones.

rattling adjective
(VERY GOOD)
informal used to emphasize that something is very good, very exciting, or keeps your attention: rattling good This is their story, and it's a rattling good read. He produced a rattling speech, full of genuine passion, and some good jokes. Synonym
rattlingly
More examplesFewer examplesHe is more than just a producer of rattling good yarns.This is, after all, a rattling good tale.I'd like nothing better right now than a rattling fine walk in the country.
